thread.title: Fundraiser for boy befriended by Wayne Hills football team - High School Sports
thread.title_full: Fundraiser for boy befriended by Wayne Hills football team - High School Sports - NorthJersey.com

author: The Record
title: Fundraiser for boy befriended by Wayne Hills football team - High School Sports
text:
Buy this photo CHRIS PEDOTA/STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER The Wayne Hills football team came to the home of Henry Catalano, 4, who is being treated for a brain tumor, to give support. PATERSON -- Tickets can be purchased for a fundraiser on Monday night at The Brownstone to benefit the family of Henry Catalano, a 4-year-old from Wayne befriended by the Wayne Hills football team and cheerleading squad while recovering from surgery to remove a malignant brain tumor.
Admission to the magic-themed, 7 p.m. event costs $100. Tickets can be purchased by contacting event coordinator Jenna Triano at henryshalos@gmail.com.
Catalano was diagnosed with a brain tumor in July. He underwent daily radiation treatments after it was removed until several weeks ago.
His family’s medical insurance only covered part of his treatment. Triano, Catalano’s aunt, also established a fundraising page to help pay for his medical bills (gofundme.com/henryshalos).
--Staff report
